result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Diante K Jacobs

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:33 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Diante K Jacobs in court.  Attorney Abigail Broze, for attorney Brandon K. Carlson, in court for Diante K Jacobs. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane.  Sandy Peplinski & Jenny Buechner appeared in person as interpreters and sworn in.  Atty. Broze provides an update; she notes Atty. Carlson is still waiting on an offer and once received will need time to review it with his client.  Atty. Broze requests a new projected plea and sentencing date in about 30 days.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing. ASL Interpreters needed for the next court date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:31 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Diante K Jacobs in court.  Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Diante K Jacobs. Interpreters Maria Kielma and Tamara Fuerst appeared in person as interpreter and sworn in.  Atty. Carlson provides an update; he is requesting a plea and sentencing date in the next 30 days.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  ASL interpreters needed for the next court date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing on September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:45 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Diante K Jacobs in court with attorney Brandon K. Carlson.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ASL Interpreters Maria Kielma & Tamara Fuerst in court and are sworn in.  Atty. Carlson provides an update, he is still waiting on some digital discovery and needs to meet with the ADA assigned to the case to discuss an offer.  Atty Carlson is requesting a further proceedings date in about 45 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings. ASL Interpreters needed for next court date.  Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

08:38 AM Defendant Diante K Jacobs in court with attorney Brandon K. Carlson.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sonja Newton appeared by Zoom as interpreter and sworn in.

Attorney Carlson states they are still in the process of getting discovery, still waiting on a pretrial offer, and states there was competency issues on previous cases and requests an adjournment.
The State does not object.
The Court will adjourn.
ASL INTERPRETER NEEDED FOR THE NEXT COURT DATE.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim A/witnesses A-C listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.   Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

08:22 AM Defendant Diante K Jacobs in court with attorney Brandon K. Carlson.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreters Jenny Buechner and Sandy Peplinski appeared and sworn in.  Victim A appeared. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
ASL INTERPERTERS NEEDED FOR THE NEXT COURT DATE.   The Interpreters state that the date works for them.  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
